Message.Title: Apple A6 TRASHES the Tegra 3 says AnandTech
Message.Msg: . When is Trash Day, boys? You'll want to be sure to put the Tegra 3 out by the curb after seeing these benchmark tests, -- conducted by AnandTech, the gold standard of benchmarking -- of the Apple self-designed A6 processor which powers the Genuine Apple iPhone 5 vs. the nvidia designed tegra 3 processor which powers the HTC One X cellphone. Google this: The iPhone 5 Performance Review by Anand Shimpi AnandTech on 9/21/2012 . Let's take a look at those benchmarks, shall we? . 1. GL Benchmark 2.5 Egypt Classic (offscreen 1080p) Frames per second -- Higher is Best 91 __ Apple A6 processor (Genuine Apple iPhone 5) 31 __ nvidia Tegra 3 chip (HTC One X) The Apple A6 is 293% faster than the nvidia Tegra 3. . 2. GL Benchmark 2.5 -- Egypt HD (offscreen 1080p) Frames per second -- Higher is Best 27 __ Apple A6 processor (Genuine Apple iPhone 5) 9 ___ nvidia Tegra 3 chip (HTC One X) The Apple A6 is 300% faster than the nvidia Tegra 3. . 3. GL Benchmark 2.5 -- Triangle Texture Test -- Vertex Lit MTriangles -- Higher is Best 86.2 __ Apple A6 processor (Genuine Apple iPhone 5) 27.4 __ nvidia Tegra 3 chip (HTC One X) The Apple A6 is 314% faster than the nvidia Tegra 3. . 4. BrowserMark -- Score in BrowserMarks Higher is Best 191,726 __ Apple A6 processor (Genuine Apple iPhone 5) 102,640 __ nvidia Tegra 3 chip (HTC One X) The Apple A6 is 186% faster than the nvidia Tegra 3. . 5. Mobile Soc GPU Comparison GFlops as shipped 25.5 __ Apple A6 GPU (Power VR SGX 543MP3) 12.0 __ nvidia Tegra 3 GPU The Apple A6 is 212% faster than the nvidia Tegra 3. . 6. GL Benchmark 2.5 -- Fill Test MTexles/s -- Higher is Best 1,650 __ Apple A6 processor (Genuine Apple iPhone 5) 407 ___ nvidia Tegra 3 chip (HTC One X) The Apple A6 is 405% faster than the nvidia Tegra 3. . Did I mention? Be sure to put that Tegra 3 to the curb, boys. It's starting to stink-up the place. .

IT AIN'T GONNA HAPPEN. Nope. Even Dear Leader Jen has told you that. But you continue to ignore the Words of Jen. Here they are again, boys. Write 'em on you hand so you don't forget this Inconvenient Truth. . "Apple does what Apple does and nobody else is going to compete with them." -- Jen Hsun Huang, MobileBeat, March 4, 2011 . That "nobody else" clearly includes nvidia's Failed Tegra Chip Folly. We can't compete with Apple, confesses Jen. Nobody can. .

Topic.Title: Apple A6 TRASHES the Tegra 3 says AnandTech

Message.Msg: . So Best? Just to Match the performance of the Genuine Apple iPhone 5, -- with that lightning-fast Apple-designed A6 processor inside -- a phone builder like HTC would need to use three, -- count 'em THREE (1, 2, 3) -- of those no-very-fast nvidia Tegra 3 chips, right? Call it three (3) foursomes of player cores -- 12 total. And a cart full of those little crippled Ninja helper cores. To find their lost balls, yell 'fore', rake the sand, fix divots and this and that. .

Topic.Title: Apple A6 chip: 1.2 GHz dual-core A15 and PowerVR 6

Message.Msg: . "I've confirmed that Apple's A6 SoC is based on Apple's own ARM based CPU core and not the Cortex A15." "The A6 is the first Apple SoC to use its own ARMv7 based processor design. The CPU core(s) aren't based on a vanilla A9 or A15 design from ARM IP, but instead are something of Apple's own creation." -- Anand Lal Shimpi, 9/15/2012 . Man 'o man! nvidia hasn't even built an ARM Cortex A15 yet, and Apple has already leap-frogged it. With their own iCreation. .

Topic.Title: Apple A6 chip: 1.2 GHz dual-core A15 and PowerVR 6

Message.Msg: Mars, actually you are wrong. The Apple A6 processor is both, based on the pairing of Cortex A15 and Cortex A7 as in “big Little” to run with more power efficiency while providing the much needed horsepower using its in-house ALU (arithmetic and logic unit) and this is why some are claiming it’s a quad-core while others are saying it’s dual-core.

Topic.Title: Apple A6 chip: 1.2 GHz dual-core A15 and PowerVR 6

Message.Msg: . Uh, thanks for your baseless opinion, bj_observer, but I'll stick with Anand Lal Shimpi, the founder of AnandTech, the gold standard of semiconductor benchmarking. . "I've confirmed that Apple's A6 SoC is based on Apple's own ARM based CPU core and not the Cortex A15." -- Anand Lal Shimpi, 9/15/2012 .

Topic.Title: Apple, do not lie: at least four Android phones are thinner than iPhone 5

Message.Msg: Android may have two years head start in LTE but only Iphone 5 and Samsung Galaxy S III are the only ones that are capable of providing “global LTE” support through their Qualcomm baseband modem MDM9615 (IP5) and MSM-8960 (Snapdragon on Galaxy) combining with Qualcomm world 3G/4G antenna (RTR8600) which have shown to provide the most used 3GPP frequency bands in the world. Nvidia’s Icera or Grey is nowhere close to providing what Qualcomm has already achieved with its 3GPP world bands. Nvidia, now more than ever, needs to expand its market beyond North America and into other continents in order to be accepted by Apple and Samsung in their consumer product lines and that means producing products for global usage and not just for your own backyard.

Message.Title: Intel will be forced to buy nvidia...here's why
Message.Msg: Intel has survived all these years purely because they have too big of a manufacturing advance lead and their own foundries. They are not an innovative company at all. They have been milking the same architecture with tweaks for 25 years plus. They will not be able to make inroads into the tablet and phone market. Its already too crowded and other companies basically hate intel because of them pushing everyone around for so many years. They can easily afford to buy nvidia and instantly establish a postion in these key markets. With their foundry capability and nvidias SOC and graphics patents technology, they will be able to once again grow the company. If they try to go it on their own, they are going to continue to lose market share and when project denver comes, they are really going to be in trouble. The fact that MSFT was willing to build their new OS to support an arch different than X86 should tell everyone that even they think its time to move on from intel. I think a merger is a real possibility. It benefits both companies since nvidia is getting squeezed on the graphics side and they are squeezing intc on the tablet/phone side...together they have a real chance...apart, i see intc struggling badly and nvidia making some in roads but not able to establish solid continuous growth. The stock is so cheap, that almost anyone could buy them easily. you only need to put up about 3 billion since they have the other 3 in cash already. What a joke...Can't believe somebody out there is not considering a takeover bid at this point. Probably waiting until the election and then things may happen. We will see.

Oh, and as always, a Big Thanks to all those longs that kindly lent Best their precious nvda shares. Thanks a Million, boys! .

Topic.Title: Intel will be forced to buy nvidia...here's why

Message.Msg: . Now why on Earth would Intel Corporation buy nvidia? Makes no sense, right? Intel already bought the best stuff. Rapicious use of ALL Existing nvidia patents -- until they expire. And the rapicious use of ALL Future nvidia patents, issued up until March 31, 2017. So there's really nothing of value left to buy. Nope. No fab plants or semiconductor making equipment or anything like that. And why would Intel want that strange-looking used office furniture? Intel buying nvidia? Never gonna happen, boys.

Message.Title: "Record 10M in weekend iPhone sales likely for Apple"
Message.Msg: "SAN FRANCISCO — Apple is poised for a record iPhone 5 debut and may not be able to keep up with demand as customers lined up in Sydney, Tokyo, Paris and New York to pick up the latest model of its top-selling product. Global sales started at the Apple Store in Sydney's George Street at 8 a.m., as about 500 people waited to buy the device. Sales also began in Japan, Hong Kong, Singapore, Germany, France, Britain, Canada and the United States. With a new wireless contract, the device costs $199, $299 and $399 in the U.S., depending on the amount of memory. Keenen Thompson, 22, waited in line for three days to be among the first to snag an iPhone at Apple's flagship store on Fifth Avenue in New York." Now go google it Nvidia fans. lol

Message.Title: Apple Asks Judge: More Damages, Triple the Total, Ban Samsung Devices, please.
Message.Msg: . Apple has dragged Samsung back to Court, this time asking that fine lady Judge Lucy Koh to increase the damages, and then Treble the total damages due from Samsung. And then BAN Samsung's patent infringing stuff from the United States. Here's the summary. . $1,050,000,000.00 __ Original jury verdict, payable to Apple $135,000,000.00 __ Additional damages due under the Patent Act $400,000,000.00 __ Additional damages due under the Lanham Act $1,585,000,000.00 __ Total damages before Trebling by the Judge x 3 = $4,755,000,000.00 __ Samsung's alleged fine for slavishly copying the Genuine iPhone . Further, Apple is Demanding that eight (8) of the patent infringing Samsung devices be PERMANENTLY BANNED from sale in these United States of America. It is unclear if that Samsung cellphone with the nvidia parts inside will be Banned. Maybe, maybe not. It's all up to that fine lady Judge Lucy Koh. Google it and weep, boys: Bloomberg Apple Asks Judge for More Damages in Samsung Patent Case .
